text: Anyone know if it is possible to password protect multiple pages at a time programmatically through the API?
is anyone online for a very basic API question (Blog API)?
Hi, I have problem with HubDB API. Hope someone can help me with these.:worried:
Cyril, maybe we can help each other :slightly_smiling_face:
What’s your issue?
Hi Nick, let me prepare the summary of the issue for you

I was able to create a PHP code to run the HubDB API so I can update data from the table (Im using PHP curl to process the request). I was using a sample published table to test update data in there and it was successful (returns http code 200). However, when I test it on the actual table, it was unsuccessful (returns http code 400 which means Bad Request). Any idea about this?
Are both your test and production tables in the same portal?
Yes they are in the same portal
both tables are also published
Is the other table have the settings turned on for public API?
both of them are turned on for public API
Sorry Cyril, that’s the extent that i’d be able to help you assuming you didn’t make a typo on the ID number
My question relates to HubSpot Blog API; specifically posting blog
Is it true we can only post one blog at a time with the API?

Row ID and Cell ID is correct actually.
Its ok Nick
didn't make any typo on them
I have not used Blog API since. Sorry Nick
That solved the problem! :grin::+1:

Hello,
I'm using this API to update specific table cell which is already working. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/hubdb/v2/update_cell>
I want to know an example URL on how it will be immediately publish to live?
I used this URL but doesn't seem to be working (404 error) - /hubdb/api/v2/tables/:tableId/rows/:rowId/cells/:cellId/publish?hapikey=MYHAPIKEY
Please help
Nevermind. I figured it out :blush:
